instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: Hi, I have another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with liquid spill around the SMC. After cleaning the PPBUS went from 8.16 to 8.56v. Orange and green light present. Fan starts to spin, stops after 10-15 seconds and then starts again and keeps spinning. I have 3.3v on both <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. 25 and 36mhz coming from the clock chip, CPU gets hot but still not booting. Also have a mouse lighting up on USB. Thoughts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: Probably still crap under the SMC. Termination resistors traces in <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> data lines also suspect.
